alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Goodhue; Rice; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:42AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Dakota, southeastern Scott, northwestern Goodhue and Rice Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 142 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Hastings to 5 miles southeast of Le Center. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cannon Falls around 155 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Morristown, Welch, Warsaw, Faribault and Red Wing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 50 and 80. U.S. Highway 61 between mile markers 85 and 89, and between mile markers 91 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Minnesota.
